data.title: Lok Sabha Elections 2024 Results: With Kannauj, Mainpuri, 35 other seats, Samajwadi Party (SP) becomes third largest party after BJP, INC
data.meta_description: Lok Sabha Elections 2024 Samajwadi Party (SP) Results: The Samajwadi Party (SP) secured as many as 37 Lok Sabha seats - all from Uttar Pradesh, the state having the largest representation in the lower house of Parliament - in the 2024 general elections, emerging the third largest party in the House of the People, after the Bharatiya Janata Party (240) and the Indian National Congress (INC). That was a dramatic victory for the SP from the 2019 polls when the party secured just five seats, even better than its record tally of 35 in 2004.  Get more India News and Business News on Zee Business.
data.text:
Lok Sabha Elections 2024 Results Samajwadi Party (SP) Winner List: Samajwadi Party (SP) chief and former UP chief minister Akhilesh Yadav won the Kannauj Lok Sabha seat in the 2024 general polls by a margin of 1.7 lakh votes against the Bharatiya Janata Party's Subrat Pathak. With that, the SP not only emerged the third largest party in the House of the People, in a dramatic leap from the 12th position in the 2019 polls, but also broke its own record of 35 seats back in 2004.

Dimple Yadav, the wife of Akhilesh Yadav and a Samajwadi Party candidate, won the Mainpuri Lok Sabha seat in the 2024 general elections. Dimple defeated the Bharatiya Janata Party's Jaiveer Singh by a margin of 2.2 lakh votes.

In fact, the husband-wife duo staged two of the biggest victories for their party in the state.

Here is the full list of Samajwadi Party candidates who emerged victorious in the 2024 polls (ranked by margin):
